block.p: The John Hancock Mutual Life Insurance Company is negotiating to sell its brokerage subsidiaries -- Tucker Anthony Inc. and Sutro & Company -- to the units' managers for $150 million to $225 million, according to Tucker Anthony's chief financial officer, Lawrence Kirshbaum. Officials of the holding company for Tucker Anthony and Sutro met today with Hancock executives to begin formal talks, he said. A Hancock spokesman had no immediate comment about the talks. John Hancock said in May that it planned to hold sale talks with Freedom executives. With combined capital of about $100 million, the brokerage firms are tiny compared with Hancock's $50.78 billion of assets.
